metadata.title: CVE-2020-16125 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
gdm3 versions before 3.36.2 or 3.38.2 would start gnome-initial-setup ifgdm3 can't contact the accountservice service via dbus in a timely manner;on Ubuntu (and potentially derivatives) this could be be chained with anadditional issue that could allow a local user to create a new privilegedaccount.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16125` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdm3 - 3.28.3-0ubuntu18.04.6
gir1.2-gdm-1.0 - 3.28.3-0ubuntu18.04.6
libgdm1 - 3.28.3-0ubuntu18.04.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdm3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.28.3-0ubuntu18.04.6').
